summary: A revised and personalized Edition of Creating a Playable Race - The Right Way, originally authored by Expired6978.  This File is a Word Document Tutorial, I hope you enjoy and benefit from it!
descriptionHtml:
[b][size=5][color=cyan] [b][font=Times New Roman]Creating a Playable Race - Revised[/font][/b][/color][/size][/b]

[b]Putting it on the line for Real Life, please view and "Like" my first documentaries.  I hope you enjoy them and share them with as many people as you can!
[/b]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUZcqHOrCUA]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUZcqHOrCUA[/url]
[color=#5ea2e5][url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yKD_r5kY4bo]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yKD_r5kY4bo[/url]
[/color]
[b][font=Georgia][color=grey]"Nothing is particularly hard if you divide it into small jobs."[/color][/font]
[color=grey]Henry Ford[/color][/b]


After successfully completing the Tutorial entitled "Creating a Playable Race - The Right Way" by Expired6978, I decided to create my own version of their .pdf format document using Microsoft Office Word.  The Tutorial I have "arranged" mainly consists of information I gathered from Expired6978 and TMPhoenix, who have both graciously given me permission to upload this document.  I would highly recommend using Microsoft Office to view the Tutorial.

I would also like to thank all of the Screenshot Artists who allowed me to use their incredible images - the HD pictures you can view within the document are amazing.

I hope that this revision helps those who may have been left feeling intimidated by the original version of the Tutorial.  This edition goes into greater explanation of the Custom Race creation procedure, and each step is numbered for easy and specific reference.

If I help one person by writing this Tutorial, then it was worth it!  If you benefit from this material, then please thank Expired6978 and TMPhoenix for their permission to let me upload it to the Nexus.  [color=cyan][b][i]Endorsements are always appreciated.[/i][/b][/color]

Though I will still provide consistent support, there will be no further revision of this Tutorial (I mean it this time).  Instead, now that I have completed the sequel to this Tutorial (entitled "Creating a Playable Race - The Next Steps"), I will be revising it in the same fashion, then I will work on a third installment which, upon completion, will provide the reader with a deep understanding of what I can only describe as "Actor Mechanics". 

I have provided a link to my newest Tutorial under the "Recommended" Section.  I encourage you to download it if you enjoyed this work.

I appreciate you taking the time to peruse my first upload to the Nexus, I hope you enjoy it - [i]send me a message if you have any questions or comments, [/i]or feel free to start an open discussion.

Please refer to the simple Change Log for details regarding minor improvements.

Good luck!




[b][size=4]Requirements[/size][/b]
Dawnguard.esm
Creation Kit
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24168][b][color=cyan]Race Compatibility for Skyrim & Dawnguard[/color][/b][/url]


[size=4][b]Recommended[/b][/size]
Microsoft Office Word
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63179][b][color=cyan]Ayleid Sanctuary - Colour Themes[/color][/b][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63308][color=cyan][b]Creating a Playable Race - The Next Steps[/b][/color][/url]
author: StackEmHigh

files.name: Creating a Playable Race - Revised
files.changelogHtml:
Changed Step 5q) to include only the "XRaceVampire" HeadParts (Thanks to TMPhoenix for informing me)
Minor grammatical fixes
